Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole and Jameson Taillon engaged in a pitching duel, each tossing six strong innings.
The Yankees fell to the Cubs, 2-1, at Wrigley Field.
Isaac Paredes’ two-run first-inning single off Cole held up as the difference.
Anthony Volpe’s second-inning sacrifice fly was the only run for the Yankees.
Ian Happ made three nice catches in left field for the Cubs.
Post-Match Reflections: Gerrit Cole expressed bittersweet feelings about the defeat, noting missed opportunities to bolster their lead in the American League East.
Jameson Taillon reflected on his friendship with Cole and the significance of their matchup.
Aaron Boone commented on Gleyber Torres' error that extended the inning.
Gleyber Torres expressed regret over missing a play that led to the Cubs' runs.
Cole mentioned his frustration with a pitch to Mike Tauchman that he thought should have been a strikeout.
Cole described the game as fun competition and looked forward to the next matchup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game coincided with Gerrit Cole’s 34th birthday.
Cole and Taillon have a long-standing friendship dating back to their time as prospects with the Pirates.
